title: Cardano Healthcare Infrastructure
description: 真に安全で、信頼できる、そして＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊分散型の医療インフラと情報交換は存在しません。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed problem statement of requirement for a decentralized health ecosystem is breing quiet addressed in the proposal although a strategy provision would have been better.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the fact that they have already implemented the hapihub they are likely to inplement the mentioned platform, but since they havent exposed much of relevent experience in Blockchain and DApps developers not sure how this is going to be built with current experience.
f6_assessments.q2: The information about the work already done and details about why the problem statement has been chosen is provided but eventough not a detailed but a phase wise stratergy for implementation on the face of proposal (Apart from one in  attachment like a timeframe wise one) would have been great to see to the implementation and progress.

f6_assessments.q0: The product has excellent underpinning. If successfully marketed, it could driveCardano adoption in a very large scale (healthcare).
f6_assessments.q1: Experince and existence of product and a well thought out and thorough approach to the industry suggests a good chance for implementation. (Normally good enough for a 5-star rating. However, the marketing strategy is not apparent. And thee is no indication of the product owners' financial capacity or approach to  business planning. Still, the concept is one that offers serious potential for growth and adoption. Evidence of support by the very large and growing Cardano community, should provided extra credibility when approaching mezzanine, seed-round and series A funders. Bravo.
f6_assessments.q2: Existence of a platform is a significant pe-cursor for success of the proposal. Adoption will be the KPI for monitoring success. Looking forward to seeing progress reports.

f6_assessments.q0:
Excelent idea and proposal. The problem really exists (integrating all medical records among patients, doctors, pharmacies, hospitals and clinicals) and solutions like this help to address this, especially after pandemic.

My main concern here is how to convince health insurances, governments, clinics and all stakeholders to join this. For it to fully work, everyone needs to be on board and the audiences are quite different, with multiple interests. To help tackle this, a business case, involving how much money and time it would save, from all different points of view, should be ellaborated. In adition, there should be an intensive "marketing campaign", to de-complicate blockchain and explore all its benefits and features in a simple manner.

Other imporant challenge is how to make it work globally, considering all different legilsations across countries.
f6_assessments.q1:
The technical team is already committed and seems capable of develiping the solution itself. However, for addressing challenges like engaging multiple stakeholders and adrressing different legislations, more people would be needed, with different background and experiences (lawyers, marketing, commercial, etc).

Regarding the plan, it's clear what still needs to be done but the plan for doing so could be clearer, divided into phases and not only the final deliverable (in a schedule format, for instance). It would be nice to see 


No budget breakdown is provided but total value is not very high for what is being proposed.
f6_assessments.q2:
The only thing in the proposal that could be audited is delivering the final integration module happi chain (final product here).
However, there could be some intermediate milestones to follow up with as project advances, to check how it is going.

It would be nice also to have some way to measure how the adoption of the happy dao will increase after this integration module is delivered, to validate if the funds really helped the bigger picture here and if the implentation was succefully - some post adoptions metrics could have been proposed.

In the same sense, typical project risks here should be taken into account like, not delivering final product on time, delivering with low quality (clients validation could help here), regulatory issues previnting product adoption, etc. This all should be managed throughout development

f6_assessments.q0:
"Problem statement :
There is no truly secure, trustless, and Decentralized Healthcare Infrastructure & Information Exchange." After looking through the proposal and documentation, it does appear that there was a lot of work put into this. One thing to note: There is duplicate proposal for fund 6 by the same proposer. (https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Cardano-Health-Infrastructure/370247-48088) Catalyst may want to keep this in mind when tallying the votes for the projects.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan itself is very interesting, and well thought out. There seems to be some existing infrastructure to build upon which are listed in the proposers links. The execution of this proposal is quite possible. However, I also think that the success of the project would be greatly determined by the team that would be working with the proposer, combined with the proposers overall experience. As I do not have a window into either, I can only guess on how successful the roll out of this project would be.
f6_assessments.q2: I do think the idea has a lot of merit, and is worthy of consideration. The documentation on HIPAA compliance and the solution itself does seem sound. With that being said, I see a request for $10000, but It do not show how the funding will be utilized. As indicated in the earlier blocks, there is no identification of the proposer, the team or their experience. I did not see a project road map either. Please consider adding these to future proposals. These items allow voters to get familiar with the people behind the project and understand the project breakdown at a glance. This also allows community member to track milestones within the project rollout.

f6_assessments.q0: Although I would be concerned about the U.S. HIPAA compliance regarding this: it seems this team has taken this into account.  Zero-Knowlege (zk) is interesting in this regard: someone can prove they may know the patient's information is not the same as the patient providing consent. Yet, having records scattered across many different systems is a concern, and this would address this, while also providing tools to other DApps and integrations. In this way this project seems highly fitting within the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Their team should be better detailed in their proposal, but in their linked Google doc: the team is detailed, and seems to have quite a few technical and knowledgeable people on the team (see HAPI Humans section in the doc).

Quite a bit of work is detailed in the Google doc and was impressive to see the work done so far. This project is ready for development and seems to have close to having research completed to know the initial direction needed for development.
f6_assessments.q2:
This is an ambitious project. This project being split into three, essentially, and $10K will get this started but it will be tight to produce three deliverables (hub, cure, and chain). This is where a budget breakdown would have been nice. Perhaps there is a way for from their linked document there has been a great deal of development already, and perhaps the $10K is just to further development and isn't the total project costs (it would be difficult if it were).

I am concerned with so many projects that seem to revolve around DID, having records on the chain or referenced on the chain, but yet all having different projects. I would hope some of these projects meld together over time.

f6_assessments.q0: Health Care is a sector where blockchain applications already exist in other ecosystems such as Ethereum. The proposer also compares the growth of Defi to that of DeHealth if you will and highlights the need to save time for other developpers
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a documentation detailing several API calls which appear related to the health sectors such as appointments and records. This documentation is a component of such an implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has set a timeline for which such an implementation can be realized. The success is however not fully defined in terms of timing and components.

f6_assessments.q0: It proposes integrating Cardano with their existing and developing healthcare information platform.
f6_assessments.q1: Development of the platform is already well underway and the team looks to be well-prepared to implement the proposal
f6_assessments.q2: The overall goal is clear, but the proposal lacks milestones and specific goals to be achieved. An example of a measurable goal could be adding test data to the Cardano blockchain by a certain date.

solution: 他のシステムプロバイダーとの相互運用を可能にし、医師や医療施設に安全でコンプライアンスの高いヘルスケアソリューションを提供します。
experience: 私たちのチームは、2016年から医療インフラのプラットフォームを構築しています - **www.hapihub.com**。また、www.mycure.md と同じチームです。
